subject: Re: [junit] @AfterClass is poorly defined
msgSnippet: The example in the doc is wrong, but the error is, that the field is not definied static. You want to share the same object across multiple test-objects. There

The example in the doc is wrong, but the error is, that the field is not
definied static.

You want to share the same object across multiple test-objects. There is
currently no other way then to declare the field static.
You can't share an object by assigning it to a field of a test object,
since JUnit creates a new object for each test method it executes.

Greetings,
   Malte
